description.narrative:
According to the World Health Organization (WHO) in 2019, only 9.3% of the Togolese population consumed clean technologies for cooking. Firewood represents 99% of primary energy production , where more than 36% of the firewood is used by households for cooking. Heavy reliance on biomass fuels for household consumption entails severe negative health effects. These fuels are inefficient energy sources and produce a range of pollutants associated with detrimental health outcomes. While replacing biomass with LPG remains a switch to fossil fuels, this change represents an important step in the countrys move towards cleaner energy sources. The current use of biomass in Togo is unsustainable and contributes to the countrys high levels of deforestation.
The most significant expected project-level outcomes are increased access to LPG products, with improvements in households air quality and resultant health effects, especially for women and children, especially in undeserved rural areas. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates the Project will further promote Competitiveness of LPG production in the market through demonstration effects in other market players in improving LPG access, in particular to undeserved rural populations as an energy transition fuel.

Zener SA (Zener or the Company) is a full-service, integrated energy provider operating in Togo, across the LPG full value chain with the only seaborne LPG import facility for end-user distribution to industrial, commercial, and residential (urban and rural) markets, as well as export. The proposed investment is up to EUR 7 million (m) IFC A loan and mobilization of up to EUR 14m in Parallel loans, to finance (i) Zeners LPG terminal capacity expansion and (ii) support the establishment of five gasoline retail stations for the distribution of white products, solar kits, and LPG bottles exchange (the Project).
